summary: I wanted to make Skyrim look like a fantasy game with deep rich colors and I accomplished just that via ENB!
descriptionHtml:
Update February 24th: I\'m uploading a new main file that should produce better cloud cover over the mountains without losing any clarity.

Please endorse if you like it!  Also, any screenshots you add will be greatly appreciated.

To activate/deactivate the effect, press SHIFT+F12 ingame. 

******************************************************FANTASY SKYRIM*********************************************************

Welcome to a world of color and atmosphere!  Skyrim is admittedly dull and has a rather grey color palette...well I livened things up by making everything more fantastical!


FEATURES
----------------------------------------------------------------
- A more vibrant look for Skyrim that brings the game to life with atmosphere.
- Darker caves and Dungeons with more emphasis on light sources; put your Magelight and Torches to use, you\'ll need them.
- Beautiful lighting, without much bloom.
- Better HDR adaptation!
- Realistic specular lighting.


INSTALLATION:
1. Download the file
2. Open the .RAR
3. Extract all files into your main Skyrim directory
(program files>steam>steamapps>common>Skyrim)
4. Enjoy
----------------------------------------------------------------
SSAO is currently disabled with this version of ENB because if causes a lot of problems for ATI users, if you wish to activate it, follow these instructions.

- Go to your \'skyrimprefs.ini\' in \'c:\\Users\\_YOURNAME_\\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim\'

- Use \'iMultiSample=1\' (You cannot have SSAO enabled while using MSAA)
- Use \'bFloatPointRenderTarget=1\' (Also required for SSAO)
- Use \'bFXAAEnabled=1\' (If you want to get rid of jaggies)  Will lower framerate
- Insert \'sD3DDevice=\"ENB\"\' (If it isn\'t there already)

- Go yo your \'enbseries.ini\' in \'c:\\Program Files (x86)\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim\' and open it.  Change \'EnableAmbientOcclusion=false\' to true.

PLEASE NOTE:
-This is not my mod!I have simply edited the files to obtain the look that I wanted. ALL CREDITS go to Boris Vorontsov for the ENB Series Graphic Enhancement.

-There are a few mods used in the pictures with the inclusion of this mod. Anything different you see, such as the clouds, the trees, the textures, etc, are from various mods found around the site and in no way belong to or were created by me.

A new adjustment created with the ENBSeries Graphic Enhancement. This graphics enhancement is so ridiculously crazy that I am literally finding myself stopping every second to look at how jaw-dropping the graphics have become. I have aimed to offer the highest possible image quality with the lowest cost of performance. Hopefully you see the beauty! It truly is breathtaking.


QUESTIONS:
If you have any questions or concerns, please refer to the ENBSeries Graphic Enhancement mod found here:
http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=2971

ENJOY! 
*******************************************************************************************

HOW TO CHANGE THE SETTINGS BY YOURSELF:

1. Open \'enbseries.ini\' located in your Main Skyrim Directory.
2. To make nights brighter, change this setting: AmbientLightingIntensityNight=0.35.  Increase the value by tenths, save and start the game to see the difference.  If you set the value above 1...glitches occur.

3. To make more fog, change this setting: FogColorMultiplierDay=0.6.   Increase the value by tenths, save and start the game to see the difference.  If you set the value above 1...glitches occur.

*******************************************************************************************
WARNING:
ENB is imperfect, and there is a give and take balance with every setting.  There will always be times in the game when it looks to bright or too dark.  This is the best balance I could find.
ENB increases the load times, you can help by tuning of ENB during load screens by pressing SHIFT+F12.

Some caveS use light sources from the day....so they will always be bright no matter what.
author: evok99

files.name: Fantasy Skyrim Less Saturation and Brighter Nights
